2084.subject: SBS
2084.descrlong: Examines principles of micro and macro economics through social science, gender, and local and global perspectives. Explores issues such as prices and markets, trade and industrial policies, labor policies, labor-management relations, global production, division of labor by gender, income distribution, poverty, sustainable development, and economic systems to examine the usefulness of theory in explaining real-life problems and their implications for people. Integrates social scientific method and economic analysis with ethics and case studies. Formerly known as SBSC 351.
